desmoj.extensions.space3D

Interface SpatialObject

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    MovableSpatialObject
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MovableSpatialEntity, MovableSpatialSimProcess, SimpleLocation, SpatialEntity, SpatialProcessQueue, SpatialQueue, SpatialSimProcess

    public interface SpatialObject
    The basic interface of the SpatialObject. It contains simple setting and getting methods of coordinates for every visible object in the simulation.

    Every SpatialObject may contain several or none entry or exit point. They define the specific coordinates where an MovableSpatialObject move to or get out, if they navigate into or out of this SpatialObject.

    • Method Detail

      • addEntryPoint

        void addEntryPoint(java.lang.String name,
                   ExtendedLength xPos,
                   ExtendedLength yPos,
                   ExtendedLength zPos)
        Adds an entry point to this SpatialObject. The given position should refer to the local coordinates of this SpatialObject.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of this entry point.
        xPos - The x-position of this entry point in local coordinates.
        yPos - The y-position of this entry point in local coordinates.
        zPos - The z-position of this entry point in local coordinates.

      • addExitPoint

        void addExitPoint(java.lang.String name,
                  ExtendedLength xPos,
                  ExtendedLength yPos,
                  ExtendedLength zPos)
        Adds an exit point to this SpatialObject. The given position should refer to the local coordinates of this SpatialObject.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of this exit point.
        xPos - The x-position of this exit point in local coordinates.
        yPos - The y-position of this exit point in local coordinates.
        zPos - The z-position of this exit point in local coordinates.

      • getEntryPointNames

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getEntryPointNames()
        Gets a set of names of all the entry points this SpatialObject contains.
        Returns:
        A set of names of the entry points.

      • getExitPointNames

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getExitPointNames()
        Gets a set of names of all the exit points this SpatialObject contains.
        Returns:
        A set of names of the exit points.

      • getEntryPoint

        ExtendedLength[] getEntryPoint(java.lang.String name)
        Gets the position of the given entry point.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the entry point.
        Returns:
        The position of the entry point in local coordinates. The first element of the array represents the x-position, the second the y-position and the third the z-position. It returns null if the SpatialObject doesn't contain the entry point with the given name.

      • getEntryPointGlobal

        ExtendedLength[] getEntryPointGlobal(java.lang.String name)
        Gets the position of the entry point in global coordinates.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the entry point.
        Returns:
        The position of the entry point in global coordinates. The first element of the array represents the x-position, the second the y-position and the third the z-position. It returns null if the SpatialObject doesn't contain the entry point with the given name.

      • getExitPoint

        ExtendedLength[] getExitPoint(java.lang.String name)
        Gets the position of the given exit point.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the exit point.
        Returns:
        The position of the exit point in local coordinates. The first element of the array represents the x-position, the second the y-position and the third the z-position. It returns null if the SpatialObject doesn't contain the exit point with the given name.

      • getExitPointGlobal

        Returns:
        The position of the exit point in global coordinates. The first element of the array represents the x-position, the second the y-position and the third the z-position. It returns null if the SpatialObject doesn't contain the exit point with the given name.
